page.title: 15VILLAGE LIFE (continued)
page.content: Florida Road estate is quite a new one and so is the one round Grasleigh Way. Above the crossroads there are three very new houses which have just been built. In the village there is a Public House called the Victoria Hotel, a newsagents and a post office, a chapel and a butchers, a bakers, an off_ licence, a shop that sells shoes and clothes and a fish 'n' chip shop. Down the road the mill has been converted into five different works. There is a printers, a firm that makes windows, a car customising centre, a carton factory, and a clothes warehouse. Further down there is a Garden Centre and a turf place. Most people work in the cities of Bradford and Leeds, but not in the village.
